result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Troy Joe Kitchner was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Troy Joe Kitchner was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay fine/costs of $4611.00.  Under the IDIP (Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program) pay $1694.00 with $2917.00 stayed.

Sentenced to 275 days in the Pepin County Jail.  Under the IDIP (Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program), defendant to serve 60 days jail with 215 days stayed.  After serving 48 hours without release, work release privileges granted.
AMENDED 02-19-2016:  1 day sentence credit approved.
AMENDED 07-06-2016:  Serve total of 90 days not 60 days with credit for time served.  Jail can figure it; with good time and work release privileges.  Additional days commencing 07-06-2016.
Concurrent with: Count 2
Operating privileges revoked for 36 months.  Under the IDIP (Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program) operating privileges revoked for 24 months with 12 months stayed.
Complete Alcohol Assessment and Driver Safety Plan.

Defendant found eligible for the IDIP (Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program).  Failure to comply with the program will result in all stays of the sentence to be lifted.
AMENDED 08-22-2016:  Defendant successfully completed the IDIP program.

30 days in the Pepin County Jail concurrent to Count 1.
Concurrent with: Count 1

Order for IID Exemption of 2005 HD cycle
Ignition Interlock Exemption request
Letter from Chambers of the Circuit Judge Re: IDIP contract.

Defendant Troy Joe Kitchner in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mr. Kitchner on IDIP program.  Court understands that at least 1 failed test and appeared before Judge Boles last week who did not terminate him and rescheduled it before Judge Duvall.  Defendant informs Court he didn't realize he took a jello shot they threw out at the parade.  State informs defendant told him he had a beer and then jello shots.  State addresses 0 tollerance program; IDIP slashes penalties; concerned with safety and protection of public; recommends he be terminated from the IDIP program.  Court notes a single jello shot won't put you over .03.  Court modifies agreement, serve a total of 90 days in jail, not 60, credit for time served, jail can figure it out, with good time, with work release; go to jail today; remain in the program.
Review hearing on July 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Troy Joe Kitchner in court, in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State informs defendant was a participant in the IDIP Program; signed the contract on 2/21/16; condition of the program is not possess or consume alcohol and be on twice a day monitoring.  State received a call yesterday that Mr. Kitchner had a positive test.  He admitted he had a beer with lunch and 3 jello shots that they gave out at the parade but he didn't know they had alcohol.  Under the IDIP Program 215 days jail was stayed; $2917.00 fine/costs stayed;  revocation of 36 mos. reduced to 24 mos. with 12 mos. stayed; he indicates he's completed over 1/2 of the 250 hours of community service; Paragraph 9 of the contract reads....  Defendant addresses the Court, been in the program since 2/21/16 and this is my 1st violation.  Court orders he be held in custody for this violation and do the formal infraction hearing when Judge Duvall returns.  Defendant inquires he if can get out for work.  State requests he remain in custody until Judge Duvall makes a decision.  Court will allow work release privileges and Sheriff can check to make sure no alcohol or revoke huber.  Return to Court on 7/5.  Review hearing scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Order for Ignition Interlock Exemption of 2001 GMC, 1994 Sunbird LE.
Ignition Interlock Exemption request of 2001 GMC & 1994 Sunbird LE.
Letter to Pepin County Sheriff with copy of IDIP Agreement, etc.

IDIP Agreement:
IDIP Program Requirements:  1)Length of IDIP Agreement.  2)Absolute Sobriety.  3)Monitored Sobriety.  4)AODA Assessment and Driver Safety Plan.  5)Payment of IDIP Program Fee.  6)Community Service Work.  7)No violations of law.  8)Other conditions.  9)Violations of the agreement.
Letter re: 1 day sentence credit approved.
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Troy Joe Kitchner in court with attorney Phillip M. Steans.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court affirms guilty pleas in count 1 & count 2 and finds defendant guilty.  Dismiss count 3.  Clerk to process on Friday.  Immediate report.
Count 3
Adjourned plea hearing at 01-04-2016 03:30 pm
Adjourned plea hearing at 01-04-2016 03:30 pm

Defendant Troy Joe Kitchner in court with attorney Phillip M. Steans.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State informs court of resolution in which defendant will plead to, currently charged as felony OWI 4th with BAC .25, defendant was shortly shy of not being 4th offense within 5 years.  State moves to amend to OWI 3rd with penalties under the IDIP 4th offense guidelines. Defendant will plead to count 2 and counsel jointly recommend 30 days jail concurrent to the OWI. Subject to plea negotiations, court grants collateral challenge as to the 2009 conviction and amend to OWI 3rd.  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court reviews PLQ/WOR form.  Court advised defendant of full penalties and reduced penalties under IDIP program.  Court advises defendant of charge in count 2/max. penalties.  Defendant pleads guilty.  Count 3 and 14TR427 will be dismissed at next hearing. Counsel referred to scheduling clerk for a date as requested after the first of the year to affirm the plea, accept pleas and sentence.
Final pre-trial at 07-20-2015 09:45 am

Jury Trial Scheduling Order:
1.  Trial of this matter is set for jury trial on August 11, 2015.  Time allowed for trial is one day.
2.  The District Attorney will send the Defense Atty their settlement offer prior to the FPT.
3.  The Defense Atty shall review the DA's settlement offer with his/her client prior to the FPT.
4.  A FPT is set for July 20, 2015 at 2:00 p.m.
5.  The Defense Atty, the Defendant, and the District Atty shall all personally appear at the FPT.
Failure of the Defendant to appear personally at the FPT shall result in the cancellation of the trial date and a warrant being issued for the defendant's arrest.
6.  All motions shall be filed in writing and no later than March 9, 2015. ....
If a motion is filed, the filing attorney shall contact the Court and obtain a pretrial motion hearing date.
Notices of alibi and responses shall follow the time limits and other requirements of Sec. 971.23(8) Wis. Stats.
7.  If either side intends to offer expert testimony..., such party shall give written notice to the court and opposing counsel no later than March 9, 2015, of the name, address and qualifications of the expert, the opinions which will be solicited from such expert and the basis for those opinions.
If any party intends to call a rebuttal expert in relation to such expert or testimony that party shall provide the same information as above w/in 15 days of receipt of the notice.  If either side opposes or seeks limitations on such expert testimony, that party shall promptly file a motion to be heard on a date before (but not at) the FPT.
8.  The State and the Defense shall file and serve no later than 5 days before the FPT:
a.  A list ... witnesses.
b.  Any nonstandard substantive or other JI they anticipate they will request be given by the Court.
9 - 10 (See Order in File)
Failure to comply with SCO may subject the attorney and parties to sanctions allowed in 805.03 Wis. Stats., including but not limited to .......

Defendant Troy Joe Kitchner in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Previously appeared before Commissioner Morgan.  Spoken with an atty?  Yes I have.  Retained an Atty?  Yes I have, Phil Steans, unable to be present with me today ask to get a date set up.  Advised of right to Prelim. Hrg. w/in 20 days if not in custody.  Court can schedule P.H. if you wish or see scheduling clerk and get his office on phone to schedule a date that meets his calendar.  All sound ok?  Yes.  Note waiver of time limits.  Continue INIT.  Remind you of conditions of cash bond, reviewed bond conditions.  Bond doesn't say "and insurance" but I am saying "and insurance".
